thread.title: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4
thread.title_full: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4

title: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4
text:
Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 12:48 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015 | Filed in: Sports Comments 0 ï»¿ 
The Pirates are on the verge of hosting the NL wild card game for the third straight year. 
Starling Marte's two-run homer in the 12th inning gave Pittsburgh a 6-4 victory over Cincinnati on Friday night that extended the Reds' losing streak to 13 games, their longest since 1945. Cincinnati Reds' Tyler Holt, bottom, dives for second on a steal as Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Jordy Mercer hops over him as he tries to catch the throw from catcher Francisco Cervelli in the fourth inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Holt went to third on the throw. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
The Pirates (97-63) maintained a two-game lead over the Chicago Cubs for home-field advantage Wednesday night in the NL wild-card game. Pittsburgh can ensure the game is at PNC Park with a win in either of its two remaining games or one Cubs loss in Milwaukee. 
"It's exciting, especially in this game where we're trying to play at home," Marte said after the Pirates rallied from a 4-0 deficit. "We play good baseball at home. We want to make our fans happy. We want to play here." 
Andrew McCutchen had three hits for the Pirates, including a home run. Cincinnati Reds starter Keyvius Sampson throws against the Pittsburgh Pirates in the first inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
Gregory Polanco drew a one-out walk from Colin Balester (1-1) in the 12th. Marte hit the next pitch into the right-field stands for his 19th homer this season and his third career walkoff shot. He also hit a game-ending homer Aug. 22 against San Francisco. 
"He continues to show up big," Pittsburgh manager Clint Hurdle said. "He likes the big situations." 
Arquimedes Caminero (5-1) pitched a scoreless inning for the win. Pittsburgh Pirates starter Francisco Liriano pitches against the Cincinnati Reds in the first inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
Eugenio Suarez had two hits and three RBIs, including a two-run homer, for the Reds. 
Both starting pitchers lasted five innings. 
Pirates left-hander Francisco Liriano allowed four runs and seven hits, and his five strikeouts raised his season total to a carreer-best 205, four more than his he had in 2010 with Minnesota. Cincinnati Reds third baseman Todd Frazier blows on his hands as he plays in the first inning of a baseball game against the Pittsburgh Pirates, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Temperatures were hovering at the 50 degree mark and expected to drop into the 40's during the game. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
Reds rookie Keyvius Sampson gave up four runs and three hits while striking out seven and walking two. The 24-year-old is 0-5 in his last nine starts. 
Pittsburgh tied it 4-all with a three-run sixth inning after loading the bases with none out to chase Sampson. 
Tony Cingrani relieved and walked pinch-hitter Michael Morse, forcing in a run. Another run scored on Pedro Alvarez's fielder's choice grounder, then Jordy Mercer tied it with an RBI single. Cincinnati Reds' Tyler Holt, right, dives for second on a steal as Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Jordy Mercer leaps to reach the throw from catcher Francisco Cervelli in the fourth inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Holt went to third on the throw. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
Cincinnati took a 4-0 lead with a pair of runs in both the second and third. 
Suarez hit his 13th homer of the season in the second. An inning later, Jay Bruce hit an RBI double and Suarez followed with a run-scoring single. 
McCutchen pulled the Pirates to 4-1 when he led the fourth inning with his 23rd homer. Pittsburgh Pirates second baseman Neil Walker hits the dirt after diving for a line drive by Cincinnati Reds' Jay Bruce in the third inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Bruce drove in Joey Votto with the hit. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
"I'm kind of at a loss for words right now," Cincinnati manager Bryan Price said. "Hard-played game, had to exploit most of the bullpen, a lot of guys down there on fumes and just trying to find a way to get through it and put ourselves in a position to win a game." 
VOTTO TIES ROSE 
Joey Votto tied a Reds record by reaching base safely in his 48th consecutive game. Votto singled in the third inning off Liriano to match Pete Rose's mark set in 1978. Cincinnati Reds' Joey Votto, left, scores from second behind Pittsburgh Pirates catcher Francisco Cervelli on a double by Jay Bruce in the third inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
Rose's run included a 44-game hitting streak, the longest in NL history. 
Votto also reached base for the 316th time this season, equaling the club record he set in 2013. 
UP NEXT CORRECTS TO TWELVE INNINGS-Pittsburgh Pirates' Starling Marte, right, is doused with water by teammates as the celebrate as Marte comes to home plate after hitting a two-run walk off game winning home run in the 12th inning of a baseball game against the Cincinnati Reds, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. The Pirates won 6-4 in twelve innings. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) 
Reds: LHP Brandon Finnegan (4-2, 3.86 ERA) will make his fourth start for Cincinnati. He is 1-2 with a 6.00 ERA since moving into the rotation Sept. 18. 
Pirates: RHP A.J. Burnett (9-6, 3.15) is 1-1 with a 3.68 ERA in four starts since being on the disabled list from July 31 to Sept. 9 with a strained flexor tendon in his right elbow. Burnett plans to retire at the end of this season, so this would likely be the last game of his 17-year career if the Pirates lose the wild-card game. Pittsburgh Pirates' Starling Marte (6) trots around the bases past Cincinnati Reds second baseman Ivan De Jesus Jr. after hitting a game winning, walk off, two-run home run in the 12th inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. The Pirates won 6-4 in 12 innings. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Pittsburgh Pirates' Michael Morse, bottom, heads to first after being walked with the bases loaded by Cincinnati Reds relief pitcher Tony Cingrani, top, in the sixth inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. The Pirates won 6-4 in 12 innings. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic) Cincinnati Reds right fielder Jay Bruce looks into the stands for the ball as Pittsburgh Pirates' Starling Marte hit a game winning two-run home run in the 12th inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. The Pirates won 6-4 in 12 innings. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic)
